column1: 4.5.7.10	  Summary of evidence and recommendations for surgical management of bladder outlet obstruction
A thorough medical history is an integral part of the evaluation of women presenting with nocturia,   including screening for sleep disorders.
Nocturia-specific questionnaires are sensitive to symptom changes.
A bladder diary allows for calculation of important indices and can identify potential causes of   nocturia.
Nocturnal-only bladder diaries have been evaluated in men only.
Consider renal function, thyroid function, HbA1c and calcium level blood tests in the initial workup of   women presenting with nocturia.
